problems.title: Circular Permutation in Binary Representation (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given 2 integers n and start. Your task is return any permutation p of (0,1,2.....,2^n -1) such that :
p[0] = start
p[i] and p[i+1] differ by only one bit in their binary representation.
p[0] and p[2^n -1] must also differ by only one bit in their binary representation.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
2 3

Sample Output
3 2 0 1

Explanation: The binary representation of the permutation is (11,10,00,01). 
All the adjacent element differ by one bit. Another valid permutation is [3,1,0,2]

Sample Input
3 2

Sample Output
2 6 7 5 4 0 1 3

Explanation: The binary representation of the permutation is (010,110,111,101,100,000,001,011).
hintsList: Generate a Gray code sequence and rotate it to start with the given value.
Use XOR to generate Gray code: gray(i) = i XOR (i >> 1).
